availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
Feby 14
The Governor approved an account of $12. to A. G. Hodges & Co for publishing proposals for work to be done at the Penitentiary as pr. orders of the Commissioners.
He Commissioned Thos. S. Burch Police Judge of the town of Campbellsville to serve out the unexpired time of D. M Mourning made vacant by resignation.

He issued a Proclamation to the Sherriffs of the Counties Composing the Third Appellate Judicial District ordering an election to be held on the 18th day of March next to fill the vacancy upon the Appellate Bench made by the death of Henry C. Wood.
He approved and signed enrolled bills Chapters 140 to 175 inclusive also enclosed Resolution No 7.
He commissioned Wm Rice and J W. Stafford Majors in the Enrolled Militia for Jessamine County.
Also the Captains, First, Second and Third Lieutenants in the Enrolled Militia for the Counties of Andersen, Clinton and Lawrence, duly elected
